Home
12 April 2019

Drum Translation for Timbral and Rhythmic Transformation

dafx19-poster-final Website accompanying results presented in the paper "Drum Translation for Timbral and Rhythmic Transformation" for the International Conference on Digital Audio Effects 2019. Poster available here.

Audio examples include:
  • 6 transformations created with the proposed automatic drum translation system
  • 20 transformation pairs used in rhythmic evaluation of the system (Sections 3.2 and 4.1 in the paper)

Figure 1: Automatic drum translation process.

Audio Examples

The audio examples are presented thanks to Trackswitch.js audio player by [2].

References:
[1] Carl Southall, Ryan Stables, and Jason Hockman, “Automatic drum transcription using bi-directional recurrent neural networks,” in Proceedings of the International Society of Music Information Retrieval Conference, pp. 591–597, 2016, Available at: https://github.com/CarlSouthall/ADTLib/.
[2] Nils Werner, Stefan Balke, Fabian Stöter, Meinard Müller and Bernd Edler, "Trackswitch.js: A Versatile Web-Based Audio Player for Presenting Scientifc Results," 2017, Available at: https://audiolabs.github.io/trackswitch.js/.
